messages: 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:04): if you have a channel with ports 1 and 2
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:04): and you try to send port2 down port1
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:04): it should obviously fail
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:04): because the semantics of that are just crazy weird
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:04): but if you send port1 down port1
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:04): should it also throw?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:05): it would be equivalent to having a rope and throwing one end to the other end
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:05): "here's a channel!"
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:05): pretty useless, since why wouldn't you just create a new MessageChannel() for yourself
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:05): i would guess most cases of port1 going down port1 will be mistakes
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:05): so it makes sense to fail big
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:05): at the point of error
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:06): instead of having hard-to-debug problems later
bb76dfcc4f591df0120c3ef31743d8e2 (11:24): is getting postMessage endpoint-passing flashbacks
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:26): bb76dfcc4f591df0120c3ef31743d8e2: hm?
bb76dfcc4f591df0120c3ef31743d8e2 (11:26): It just sounds so similar
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:27): it is more than similar
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:27): it's the same thing
bb76dfcc4f591df0120c3ef31743d8e2 (11:27): That would explain it then
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:33): roc and mjs came up with the better names
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:33): pipe become message channel
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:33): and end point and pipe end become message port
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:34): s/become/became/
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:34): i'm doing dvorak-layout typos while typing on a qwerty keyboard
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:34): that's freaky
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:35): that suggests that when i do typos, i'm hitting the keys my brain intended to hit
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:35): but that my brain doesn't have a good idea of what keys to hit, and that it makes mistakes based on locality of the keyboard layout
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:35): but that the mistakes it makes aren't necessarily related to the keyboard layout it is actually typing on
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (11:49): http://blogs.msdn.com/ie/archive/2008/07/14/ie8-ajax-navigation.aspx
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (12:10): wish they'd say what they actually implemented :-)
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (12:12): just the hashchanged event apparently
